title: PHPlcfirst()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPlcfirst()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Convert the first character of "Hello" to lowercase:
<?php
echo lcfirst("Hello world!");
?>

Definition and Usage
The lcfirst() function converts the first character of a string to lowercase.
Related functions:
ucfirst()
- converts the first character of a string to uppercase
ucwords()
- converts the first character of each word in a string to uppercase
strtoupper()
- converts a string to uppercase
strtolower()
- converts a string to lowercase
Syntax
lcfirst(
string
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. Specifies the string to convert
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns the converted string
PHP Version:
5.3.0+

+1
